result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn Harris Goplen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawn Harris Goplen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shawn Harris Goplen was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: COURT SENTENCES THE DEFENDANT TO TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Harris Goplen

records.addlTxt: 10:27  This also includes 15CF269   Defendant Shawn Harris Goplen in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie 15CF269 Plead to Ct 1  Dismiss Ct 2 and 15CF145  Sentence to time served.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY  to Ct 1 in 15CF269    Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS of Ct 1 15CF269  Court dismisses Ct 2 and 15CF145  .  Court sentences the defendant to time served.  DNA sample is ordered.

Final pre-trial at 05-23-2016 09:00 am.
Jury trial at 06-10-2016 08:30 am.
Def pleas not guilty. Court rec/enter.

11:41 Defendant Shawn Harris Goplen in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  Defendant Shawn Harris Goplen in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Chase Westfield swn, ex by Thorie. ID's Defendant.  Court will take judicial notice of bail bond in case 15CF145. Amann x ex. Atty Thorie gives argument for bind over. Court based on the evidences finds probable cause a felony has been commited as alledged and bind over. Thorie files information giving Def a copy.  Def waives reading of information.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 3:3 Defendant Shawn Harris Goplen in court, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court via phone.   Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Thorie: Defendant subject to MN authorizes wishing to extradite him. Suggests a cash bond. Nelson agrees to a cash bond -$100-$200. Thorie suggests $500 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 11:45 am.
